messages.content: Create implementation plan for: Create a movie tracking app where i can track the movies i watch

<plan>
  <overview>
    A comprehensive movie tracking application that allows users to log, rate, and review movies they've watched. Features include movie discovery via search, personal watch history with ratings and reviews, wishlist functionality, viewing statistics, and social sharing capabilities. The app will provide a beautiful, Netflix-inspired interface with smooth animations and rich data visualization.
  </overview>
  
  <architecture>
    The application follows a modern microservices architecture with FastAPI backend providing RESTful APIs and React frontend with TypeScript. The backend uses SQLAlchemy for database management with PostgreSQL, while the frontend leverages React Query for state management and optimistic updates. The UI is built with shadcn/ui components and Tailwind CSS for a premium, responsive design. Movie data is enriched using TMDB API integration for comprehensive movie information including posters, cast, and metadata.
  </architecture>
  
  <steps>
    <step id="1" name="Core Backend Models & Database" priority="high" dependencies="">
      <description>Establish the foundational data models and database schema for movies, users, and tracking relationships</description>

from pydantic import BaseModel, Field, validator
from typing import Optional, List
from datetime import datetime
from enum import Enum

class MovieStatus(str, Enum):
    WATCHED = "watched"
    WATCHING = "watching"
    PLAN_TO_WATCH = "plan_to_watch"
    DROPPED = "dropped"

class Genre(BaseModel):
    id: int
    name: str

class ProductionCompany(BaseModel):
    id: int
    name: str
    logo_path: Optional[str] = None
    origin_country: Optional[str] = None

class ProductionCountry(BaseModel):
    iso_3166_1: str
    name: str

class SpokenLanguage(BaseModel):
    english_name: str
    iso_639_1: str
    name: str

class CastMember(BaseModel):
    id: int
    name: str
    character: str
    profile_path: Optional[str] = None
    order: int

class CrewMember(BaseModel):
    id: int
    name: str
    job: str
    department: str
    profile_path: Optional[str] = None

class MovieBase(BaseModel):
    title: str = Field(..., min_length=1, max_length=200)
    original_title: Optional[str] = None
    overview: Optional[str] = None
    release_date: Optional[str] = None
    runtime: Optional[int] = Field(None, ge=1, le=500)
    tagline: Optional[str] = None
    status: Optional[str] = None
    budget: Optional[int] = Field(None, ge=0)
    revenue: Optional[int] = Field(None, ge=0)
    homepage: Optional[str] = None
    imdb_id: Optional[str] = None
    original_language: Optional[str] = None
    poster_path: Optional[str] = None
    backdrop_path: Optional[str] = None

class MovieCreate(MovieBase):
    tmdb_id: int = Field(..., gt=0)
    genres: List[Genre] = []
    production_companies: List[ProductionCompany] = []
    production_countries: List[ProductionCountry] = []
    spoken_languages: List[SpokenLanguage] = []

class MovieUpdate(BaseModel):
    title: Optional[str] = Field(None, min_length=1, max_length=200)
    overview: Optional[str] = None
    release_date: Optional[str] = None
    runtime: Optional[int] = Field(None, ge=1, le=500)
    poster_path: Optional[str] = None
    backdrop_path: Optional[str] = None

class MovieResponse(MovieBase):
    id: str
    tmdb_id: int
    genres: List[Genre] = []
    production_companies: List[ProductionCompany] = []
    production_countries: List[ProductionCountry] = []
    spoken_languages: List[SpokenLanguage] = []
    cast: List[CastMember] = []
    crew: List[CrewMember] = []
    vote_average: Optional[float] = None
    vote_count: Optional[int] = None
    popularity: Optional[float] = None
    created_at: datetime
    updated_at: datetime

    class Config:
        from_attributes = True

class MovieSearchResult(BaseModel):
    id: str
    tmdb_id: int
    title: str
    release_date: Optional[str] = None
    poster_path: Optional[str] = None
    vote_average: Optional[float] = None
    overview: Optional[str] = None

class MovieFilter(BaseModel):
    query: Optional[str] = None
    genres: Optional[List[int]] = None
    year_from: Optional[int] = None
    year_to: Optional[int] = None
    rating_from: Optional[float] = None
    rating_to: Optional[float] = None
    sort_by: Optional[str] = Field("popularity", regex="^(popularity|release_date|title|vote_average)$")
    sort_order: Optional[str] = Field("desc", regex="^(asc|desc)$")
    page: int = Field(1, ge=1)
    limit: int = Field(20, ge=1, le=100)
</action>

from pydantic import BaseModel, Field, validator
from typing import Optional
from datetime import datetime
from enum import Enum

class UserRole(str, Enum):
    USER = "user"
    ADMIN = "admin"
    PREMIUM = "premium"

class UserBase(BaseModel):
    username: str = Field(..., min_length=3, max_length=50, regex="^[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$")
    email: str = Field(..., regex="^[\w\.-]+@[\w\.-]+\.\w+$")
    full_name: Optional[str] = Field(None, min_length=1, max_length=100)
    bio: Optional[str] = Field(None, max_length=500)
    avatar_url: Optional[str] = None
    location: Optional[str] = Field(None, max_length=100)
    website: Optional[str] = None
    is_verified: bool = False
    is_active: bool = True
    role: UserRole = UserRole.USER

class UserCreate(UserBase):
    password: str = Field(..., min_length=8, max_length=100)

class UserUpdate(BaseModel):
    username: Optional[str] = Field(None, min_length=3, max_length=50, regex="^[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$")
    email: Optional[str] = Field(None, regex="^[\w\.-]+@[\w\.-]+\.\w+$")
    full_name: Optional[str] = Field(None, min_length=1, max_length=100)
    bio: Optional[str] = Field(None, max_length=500)
    avatar_url: Optional[str] = None
    location: Optional[str] = Field(None, max_length=100)
    website: Optional[str] = None

class UserResponse(UserBase):
    id: str
    created_at: datetime
    updated_at: datetime
    last_login: Optional[datetime] = None
    total_movies_watched: int = 0
    total_reviews_written: int = 0
    average_rating: Optional[float] = None
    favorite_genres: Optional[list] = None

    class Config:
        from_attributes = True

class UserLogin(BaseModel):
    username: str = Field(..., min_length=1)
    password: str = Field(..., min_length=1)

class UserToken(BaseModel):
    access_token: str
    token_type: str = "bearer"
    expires_in: int = 3600
    user: UserResponse

class PasswordReset(BaseModel):
    email: str = Field(..., regex="^[\w\.-]+@[\w\.-]+\.\w+$")

class PasswordResetConfirm(BaseModel):
    token: str
    new_password: str = Field(..., min_length=8, max_length=100)

class UserPreferences(BaseModel):
    theme: str = Field("dark", regex="^(light|dark|auto)$")
    language: str = Field("en", regex="^(en|es|fr|de|it|pt|ru|ja|ko|zh)$")
    notifications: dict = Field(default_factory=lambda: {
        "email": True,
        "push": True,
        "review_likes": True,
        "follows": True,
        "recommendations": True
    })
    privacy: dict = Field(default_factory=lambda: {
        "profile_public": True,
        "watch_history_public": False,
        "reviews_public": True,
        "watchlist_public": True
    })
    display: dict = Field(default_factory=lambda: {
        "show_spoilers": False,
        "show_adult_content": False,
        "default_sort": "date_added",
        "poster_quality": "high"
    })
</action>

from pydantic import BaseModel, Field, validator
from typing import Optional, List
from datetime import datetime
from enum import Enum

class RatingScale(int, Enum):
    TERRIBLE = 1
    BAD = 2
    AVERAGE = 3
    GOOD = 4
    EXCELLENT = 5

class WatchStatus(str, Enum):
    COMPLETED = "completed"
    WATCHING = "watching"
    ON_HOLD = "on_hold"
    DROPPED = "dropped"
    PLAN_TO_WATCH = "plan_to_watch"

class ReviewStatus(str, Enum):
    DRAFT = "draft"
    PUBLISHED = "published"
    HIDDEN = "hidden"

class WatchHistoryBase(BaseModel):
    movie_id: str
    user_id: str
    status: WatchStatus = WatchStatus.COMPLETED
    progress: int = Field(0, ge=0, le=100)  # percentage
    started_at: Optional[datetime] = None
    completed_at: Optional[datetime] = None
    rewatch_count: int = Field(0, ge=0)
    notes: Optional[str] = Field(None, max_length=1000)
    tags: List[str] = Field(default_factory=list)

class WatchHistoryCreate(WatchHistoryBase):
    pass

class WatchHistoryUpdate(BaseModel):
    status: Optional[WatchStatus] = None
    progress: Optional[int] = Field(None, ge=0, le=100)
    completed_at: Optional[datetime] = None
    notes: Optional[str] = Field(None, max_length=1000)
    tags: Optional[List[str]] = None

class WatchHistoryResponse(WatchHistoryBase):
    id: str
    created_at: datetime
    updated_at: datetime
    movie: dict  # populated from movie service
    total_watch_time: Optional[int] = None  # in minutes

    class Config:
        from_attributes = True

class RatingBase(BaseModel):
    movie_id: str
    user_id: str
    rating: int = Field(..., ge=1, le=5)
    rated_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow)

class RatingCreate(RatingBase):
    pass

class RatingUpdate(BaseModel):
    rating: int = Field(..., ge=1, le=5)

class RatingResponse(RatingBase):
    id: str
    created_at: datetime
    updated_at: datetime
    movie: dict  # populated from movie service

    class Config:
        from_attributes = True

class ReviewBase(BaseModel):
    movie_id: str
    user_id: str
    title: str = Field(..., min_length=1, max_length=200)
    content: str = Field(..., min_length=10, max_length=10000)
    rating: int = Field(..., ge=1, le=5)
    status: ReviewStatus = ReviewStatus.PUBLISHED
    contains_spoilers: bool = False
    tags: List[str] = Field(default_factory=list)

class ReviewCreate(ReviewBase):
    pass

class ReviewUpdate(BaseModel):
    title: Optional[str] = Field(None, min_length=1, max_length=200)
    content: Optional[str] = Field(None, min_length=10, max_length=10000)
    rating: Optional[int] = Field(None, ge=1, le=5)
    status: Optional[ReviewStatus] = None
    contains_spoilers: Optional[bool] = None
    tags: Optional[List[str]] = None

class ReviewResponse(ReviewBase):
    id: str
    created_at: datetime
    updated_at: datetime
    likes_count: int = 0
    comments_count: int = 0
    is_liked: Optional[bool] = None
    user: dict  # populated from user service
    movie: dict  # populated from movie service

    class Config:
        from_attributes = True

class WishlistBase(BaseModel):
    movie_id: str
    user_id: str
    priority: int = Field(1, ge=1, le=5)
    notes: Optional[str] = Field(None, max_length=500)
    added_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=datetime.utcnow)
    reminder_date: Optional[datetime] = None

class WishlistCreate(WishlistBase):
    pass

class WishlistUpdate(BaseModel):
    priority: Optional[int] = Field(None, ge=1, le=5)
    notes: Optional[str] = Field(None, max_length=500)

class WishlistResponse(WishlistBase):
    id: str

class ActivityFeed(BaseModel):

class UserStats(BaseModel):

<action type="file" filePath="backend/services/database.py">
from sqlalchemy import create_engine, MetaData
from sqlalchemy.ext.declarative import declarative_base
from sqlalchemy.orm import sessionmaker, Session
from sqlalchemy.pool import StaticPool
import os
from typing import Generator

# Database configuration
DATABASE_URL = os.getenv("DATABASE_URL", "sqlite:///./movie_tracker.db")

# Create engine with connection pooling
if DATABASE_URL.startswith("sqlite"):
    engine = create_engine(
        DATABASE_URL,
        connect_args={"check_same_thread": False},
        poolclass=StaticPool,
    )
else:
    engine = create_engine(
        DATABASE_URL,
        pool_size=20,
        max_overflow=30,
        pool_pre_ping=True,
        pool_recycle=3600,
    )

# Create session factory
SessionLocal = sessionmaker(
    autocommit=False,
    autoflush=False,
    bind=engine,
    expire_on_commit=False,
)

# Create base class for models
Base = declarative_base()
metadata = MetaData()

# Dependency for FastAPI
def get_db() -> Generator[Session, None, None]:
    """Database session dependency for FastAPI endpoints."""
    db = SessionLocal()
    try:
        yield db
    finally:
        db.close()

# Database initialization
def init_db() -> None:
    """Initialize database tables."""
    from sqlalchemy import inspect
    
    # Import all models to ensure they're registered
    from models.sql_models import (
        User,
        Movie,
        WatchHistory,
        Rating,
        Review,
        Wishlist,
        Activity,
    )
    
    # Create all tables
    Base.metadata.create_all(bind=engine)
    
    # Verify tables were created
    inspector = inspect(engine)
    tables = inspector.get_table_names()
    print(f"Database initialized with tables: {tables}")

# Health check
def check_db_health() -> dict:
    """Check database connection health."""
    try:
        with engine.connect() as conn:
            conn.execute("SELECT 1")
        return {"status": "healthy", "database": DATABASE_URL.split("://")[0]}
    except Exception as e:
        return {"status": "unhealthy", "error": str(e)}

# Database utilities
class DatabaseManager:
    """Database management utilities."""
    
    @staticmethod
    def reset_database() -> None:
        """Reset all database tables (use with caution)."""
        Base.metadata.drop_all(bind=engine)
        Base.metadata.create_all(bind=engine)
    
    @staticmethod
    def get_table_stats() -> dict:
        """Get statistics about database tables."""
        stats = {}
        with SessionLocal() as db:
            for table_name in ["users", "movies", "watch_history", "ratings", "reviews", "wishlist"]:
                try:
                    result = db.execute(f"SELECT COUNT(*) FROM {table_name}")
                    stats[table_name] = result.scalar()
                except Exception:
                    stats[table_name] = 0
        return stats
    
    @staticmethod
    def vacuum() -> None:
        """Optimize database (SQLite only)."""
        if DATABASE_URL.startswith("sqlite"):
            with engine.connect() as conn:
                conn.execute("VACUUM")
                conn.execute("ANALYZE")

# Export for use in other modules
__all__ = ["get_db", "init_db", "check_db_health", "DatabaseManager", "Base"]
</action>

import httpx
import os
from typing import Optional, List, Dict, Any
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
import redis
import json
from functools import lru_cache
import logging

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

class TMDBService:
    """Service for interacting with The Movie Database (TMDB) API."""
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.api_key = os.getenv("TMDB_API_KEY")
        self.base_url = "https://api.themoviedb.org/3"
        self.image_base_url = "https://image.tmdb.org/t/p"
        self.redis_client = None
        
        # Initialize Redis for caching if available
        try:
            self.redis_client = redis.Redis(
                host=os.getenv("REDIS_HOST", "localhost"),
                port=int(os.getenv("REDIS_PORT", 6379)),
                db=0,
                decode_responses=True
            )
            self.redis_client.ping()
        except Exception:
            logger.warning("Redis not available, using in-memory cache")
            self.redis_client = None
    
    async def _make_request(self, endpoint: str, params: Dict[str, Any] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Make authenticated request to TMDB API."""
        if not self.api_key:
            raise ValueError("TMDB_API_KEY not configured")
        
        params = params or {}
        params["api_key"] = self.api_key
        
        async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
            response = await client.get(
                f"{self.base_url}/{endpoint}",
                params=params,
                timeout=30.0
            )
            response.raise_for_status()
            return response.json()
    
    def _get_cache_key(self, prefix: str, identifier: str) -> str:
        """Generate cache key for Redis."""
        return f"tmdb:{prefix}:{identifier}"
    
    def _cache_get(self, key: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
        """Get value from cache."""
        if self.redis_client:
            try:
                value = self.redis_client.get(key)
                if value:
                    return json.loads(value)
            except Exception as e:
                logger.error(f"Redis get error: {e}")
        return None
    
    def _cache_set(self, key: str, value: Dict[str, Any], ttl: int = 3600) -> None:
        """Set value in cache."""
        if self.redis_client:
            try:
                self.redis_client.setex(key, ttl, json.dumps(value))
            except Exception as e:
                logger.error(f"Redis set error: {e}")
    
    async def get_movie_details(self, tmdb_id: int) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get detailed movie information from TMDB."""
        cache_key = self._get_cache_key("movie", str(tmdb_id))
        
        # Check cache first
        cached = self._cache_get(cache_key)
        if cached:
            return cached
        
        try:
            # Get basic movie details
            movie_data = await self._make_request(f"movie/{tmdb_id}", {
                "append_to_response": "credits,videos,images,reviews"
            })
            
            # Process and clean data
            processed_data = {
                "tmdb_id": movie_data["id"],
                "title": movie_data["title"],
                "original_title": movie_data.get("original_title"),
                "overview": movie_data.get("overview"),
                "release_date": movie_data.get("release_date"),
                "runtime": movie_data.get("runtime"),
                "tagline": movie_data.get("tagline"),
                "status": movie_data.get("status"),
                "budget": movie_data.get("budget"),
                "revenue": movie_data.get("revenue"),
                "homepage": movie_data.get("homepage"),
                "imdb_id": movie_data.get("imdb_id"),
                "original_language": movie_data.get("original_language"),
                "poster_path": movie_data.get("poster_path"),
                "backdrop_path": movie_data.get("backdrop_path"),
                "vote_average": movie_data.get("vote_average"),
                "vote_count": movie_data.get("vote_count"),
                "popularity": movie_data.get("popularity"),
                "genres": [{"id": g["id"], "name": g["name"]} for g in movie_data.get("genres", [])],
                "production_companies": [
                    {
                        "id": c["id"],
                        "name": c["name"],
                        "logo_path": c.get("logo_path"),
                        "origin_country": c.get("origin_country")
                    }
                    for c in movie_data.get("production_companies", [])
                ],
                "production_countries": [
                    {
                        "iso_3166_1": c["iso_3166_1"],
                        "name": c["name"]
                    }
                    for c in movie_data.get("production_countries", [])
                ],
                "spoken_languages": [
                    {
                        "english_name": l["english_name"],
                        "iso_639_1": l["iso_639_1"],
                        "name": l["name"]
                    }
                    for l in movie_data.get("spoken_languages", [])
                ],
                "cast": [
                    {
                        "id": c["id"],
                        "name": c["name"],
                        "character": c.get("character", ""),
                        "profile_path": c.get("profile_path"),
                        "order": c.get("order", 0)
                    }
                    for c in movie_data.get("credits", {}).get("cast", [])[:20]
                ],
                "crew": [
                    {
                        "id": c["id"],
                        "name": c["name"],
                        "job": c.get("job", ""),
                        "department": c.get("department", ""),
                        "profile_path": c.get("profile_path")
                    }
                    for c in movie_data.get("credits", {}).get("crew", [])
                    if c.get("job") in ["Director", "Producer", "Screenplay", "Writer", "Cinematography", "Editor"]
                ],
                "videos": [
                    {
                        "id": v["id"],
                        "key": v["key"],
                        "name": v["name"],
                        "site": v["site"],
                        "type": v["type"]
                    }
                    for v in movie_data.get("videos", {}).get("results", [])
                    if v["site"] == "YouTube"
                ]
            }
            
            # Cache for 1 hour
            self._cache_set(cache_key, processed_data, 3600)
            return processed_data
            
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Error fetching movie {tmdb_id}: {e}")
            raise
    
    async def search_movies(
        self,
        query: str,
        page: int = 1,
        year: Optional[int] = None,
        include_adult: bool = False
    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Search for movies by query."""
        params = {
            "query": query,
            "page": page,
            "include_adult": include_adult
        }
        if year:
            params["year"] = year
        
        try:
            data = await self._make_request("search/movie", params)
            
            # Process results
            processed_results = {
                "page": data["page"],
                "total_pages": data["total_pages"],
                "total_results": data["total_results"],
                "results": [
                    {
                        "tmdb_id": movie["id"],
                        "title": movie["title"],
                        "release_date": movie.get("release_date"),
                        "poster_path": movie.get("poster_path"),
                        "vote_average": movie.get("vote_average"),
                        "overview": movie.get("overview", "")[:200] + "...",
                        "popularity": movie.get("popularity")
                    }
                    for movie in data.get("results", [])
                ]
            }
            
            return processed_results
            
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Error searching movies: {e}")
            raise
    
    async def get_trending_movies(self, time_window: str = "week") -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
        """Get trending movies."""
        cache_key = self._get_cache_key("trending", time_window)
        
        cached = self._cache_get(cache_key)
        if cached:
            return cached
        
        try:
            data = await self._make_request(f"trending/movie/{time_window}")
            
            results = [
                {
                    "tmdb_id": movie["id"],
                    "title": movie["title"],
                    "release_date": movie.get("release_date"),
                    "poster_path": movie.get("poster_path"),
                    "vote_average": movie.get("vote_average"),
                    "overview": movie.get("overview", "")[:150] + "...",
                    "popularity": movie.get("popularity")
                }
                for movie in data.get("results", [])[:20]
            ]
            
            # Cache for 30 minutes
            self._cache_set(cache_key, results, 1800)
            return results
            
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Error fetching trending movies: {e}")
            raise
    
    async def get_popular_movies(self, page: int = 1) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get popular movies."""
        try:
            data = await self._make_request("movie/popular", {"page": page})
            
            return {
                "page": data["page"],
                "total_pages": data["total_pages"],
                "total_results": data["total_results"],
                "results": [
                    {
                        "tmdb_id": movie["id"],
                        "title": movie["title"],
                        "release_date": movie.get("release_date"),
                        "poster_path": movie.get("poster_path"),
                        "vote_average": movie.get("vote_average"),
                        "overview": movie.get("overview", "")[:200] + "...",
                        "popularity": movie.get("popularity")
                    }
                    for movie in data.get("results", [])
                ]
            }
            
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Error fetching popular movies: {e}")
            raise
    
    def get_image_url(self, path: str, size: str = "w500") -> str:
        """Get full image URL from TMDB path."""
        if not path:
            return ""
        return f"{self.image_base_url}/{size}{path}"
    
    def get_backdrop_url(self, path: str, size: str = "w1280") -> str:
        """Get backdrop image URL."""
        return self.get_image_url(path, size)
    
    def get_poster_url(self, path: str, size: str = "w500") -> str:
        """Get poster image URL."""
        return self.get_image_url(path, size)
    
    def get_profile_url(self, path: str, size: str = "w185") -> str:
        """Get profile image URL."""
        return self.get_image_url(path, size)

# Global instance
tmdb_service = TMDBService()

from typing import List, Optional, Dict, Any
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from sqlalchemy import and_, or_, desc, asc, func
from sqlalchemy.sql import text
from models.movie_models import MovieFilter
from models.sql_models import Movie, Genre, MovieGenre
from services.database import get_db
import logging

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

class SearchService:
    """Advanced search service for movies with filtering and sorting."""
    
    def __init__(self, db: Session):
        self.db = db
    
    def search_movies(self, filters: MovieFilter) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Search movies with advanced filtering."""
        query = self.db.query(Movie)
        
        # Apply text search
        if filters.query:
            search_term = f"%{filters.query}%"
            query = query.filter(
                or_(
                    Movie.title.ilike(search_term),
                    Movie.original_title.ilike(search_term),
                    Movie.overview.ilike(search_term)
                )
            )
        
        # Apply genre filter
        if filters.genres:
            query = query.join(Movie.genres).filter(
                Genre.id.in_(filters.genres)
            )
        
        # Apply year filter
        if filters.year_from or filters.year_to:
            if filters.year_from:
                query = query.filter(
                    func.extract('year', func.cast(Movie.release_date, Date)) >= filters.year_from
                )
            if filters.year_to:
                query = query.filter(
                    func.extract('year', func.cast(Movie.release_date, Date)) <= filters.year_to
                )
        
        # Apply rating filter
        if filters.rating_from or filters.rating_to:
            if filters.rating_from:
                query = query.filter(Movie.vote_average >= filters.rating_from)
            if filters.rating_to:
                query = query.filter(Movie.vote_average <= filters.rating_to)
        
        # Apply sorting
        sort_mapping = {
            "popularity": Movie.popularity,
            "release_date": Movie.release_date,
            "title": Movie.title,
            "vote_average": Movie.vote_average
        }
        
        sort_column = sort_mapping.get(filters.sort_by, Movie.popularity)
        if filters.sort_order == "asc":
            query = query.order_by(asc(sort_column))
        else:
            query = query.order_by(desc(sort_column))
        
        # Get total count
        total = query.count()
        
        # Apply pagination
        offset = (filters.page - 1) * filters.limit
        movies = query.offset(offset).limit(filters.limit).all()
        
        return {
            "movies": movies,
            "total": total,
            "page": filters.page,
            "total_pages": (total + filters.limit - 1) // filters.limit
        }
    
    def get_movies_by_genre(self, genre_id: int, page: int = 1, limit: int = 20) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get movies by genre."""
        query = self.db.query(Movie).join(Movie.genres).filter(Genre.id == genre_id)
        
        total = query.count()
        offset = (page - 1) * limit
        movies = query.offset(offset).limit(limit).all()
        
        return {
            "movies": movies,
            "total": total,
            "page": page,
            "total_pages": (total + limit - 1) // limit
        }
    
    def get_movies_by_year(self, year: int, page: int = 1, limit: int = 20) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get movies by release year."""
        query = self.db.query(Movie).filter(
            func.extract('year', func.cast(Movie.release_date, Date)) == year
        )
        
        total = query.count()
        offset = (page - 1) * limit
        movies = query.order_by(desc(Movie.vote_average)).offset(offset).limit(limit).all()
        
        return {
            "movies": movies,
            "total": total,
            "page": page,
            "total_pages": (total + limit - 1) // limit
        }
    
    def get_top_rated_movies(self, min_votes: int = 100, page: int = 1, limit: int = 20) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get top rated movies with minimum vote count."""
        query = self.db.query(Movie).filter(
            Movie.vote_count >= min_votes
        ).order_by(desc(Movie.vote_average))
        
        total = query.count()
        offset = (page - 1) * limit
        movies = query.offset(offset).limit(limit).all()
        
        return {
            "movies": movies,
            "total": total,
            "page": page,
            "total_pages": (total + limit - 1) // limit
        }
    
    def get_recent_movies(self, days: int = 30, page: int = 1, limit: int = 20) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get recently released movies."""
        cutoff_date = datetime.utcnow() - timedelta(days=days)
        
        query = self.db.query(Movie).filter(
            Movie.release_date >= cutoff_date
        ).order_by(desc(Movie.release_date))
        
        total = query.count()
        offset = (page - 1) * limit
        movies = query.offset(offset).limit(limit).all()
        
        return {
            "movies": movies,
            "total": total,
            "page": page,
            "total_pages": (total + limit - 1) // limit
        }
    
    def get_similar_movies(self, movie_id: str, limit: int = 10) -> List[Movie]:
        """Get similar movies based on genres."""
        movie = self.db.query(Movie).filter(Movie.id == movie_id).first()
        if not movie:
            return []
        
        genre_ids = [g.id for g in movie.genres]
        
        similar_movies = self.db.query(Movie).join(Movie.genres).filter(
            Genre.id.in_(genre_ids),
            Movie.id != movie_id
        ).group_by(Movie.id).order_by(
            desc(func.count(Genre.id))
        ).limit(limit).all()
        
        return similar_movies
    
    def get_movie_stats(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get movie database statistics."""
        stats = {
            "total_movies": self.db.query(Movie).count(),
            "total_genres": self.db.query(Genre).count(),
            "average_rating": self.db.query(func.avg(Movie.vote_average)).scalar() or 0,
            "movies_this_year": self.db.query(Movie).filter(
                func.extract('year', func.cast(Movie.release_date, Date)) == datetime.utcnow().year
            ).count(),
            "top_genres": self.db.query(
                Genre.name,
                func.count(Movie.id).label('count')
            ).join(MovieGenre).join(Movie).group_by(
                Genre.id, Genre.name
            ).order_by(desc('count')).limit(10).all()
        }
        
        return stats
    
    def autocomplete_search(self, query: str, limit: int = 10) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
        """Autocomplete search for movie titles."""
        search_term = f"{query}%"
        movies = self.db.query(Movie).filter(
            Movie.title.ilike(search_term)
        ).order_by(
            desc(Movie.popularity)
        ).limit(limit).all()
        
        return [
            {
                "id": movie.id,
                "title": movie.title,
                "release_date": movie.release_date,
                "poster_path": movie.poster_path,
                "tmdb_id": movie.tmdb_id
            }
            for movie in movies
        ]

# Dependency injection
def get_search_service(db: Session = Depends(get_db)) -> SearchService:
    return SearchService(db)

from fastapi import APIRouter, HTTPException, Depends, Query
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from sqlalchemy.exc import IntegrityError
from typing import List, Optional
from uuid import uuid4
from datetime import datetime

from models.movie_models import (
    MovieCreate, MovieUpdate, MovieResponse, MovieFilter, MovieSearchResult
)
from models.sql_models import Movie, Genre, MovieGenre
from services.database import get_db
from services.tmdb_service import tmdb_service
from services.search_service import SearchService, get_search_service

router = APIRouter()

@router.post("/movies", response_model=MovieResponse)
async def create_movie(
    movie: MovieCreate,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Create a new movie from TMDB data."""
    # Check if movie already exists
    existing_movie = db.query(Movie).filter(Movie.tmdb_id == movie.tmdb_id).first()
    if existing_movie:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=409, detail="Movie already exists")
    
    try:
        # Fetch detailed data from TMDB
        tmdb_data = await tmdb_service.get_movie_details(movie.tmdb_id)
        
        # Create movie
        db_movie = Movie(
            id=str(uuid4()),
            tmdb_id=movie.tmdb_id,
            title=tmdb_data["title"],
            original_title=tmdb_data.get("original_title"),
            overview=tmdb_data.get("overview"),
            release_date=tmdb_data.get("release_date"),
            runtime=tmdb_data.get("runtime"),
            tagline=tmdb_data.get("tagline"),
            status=tmdb_data.get("status"),
            budget=tmdb_data.get("budget"),
            revenue=tmdb_data.get("revenue"),
            homepage=tmdb_data.get("homepage"),
            imdb_id=tmdb_data.get("imdb_id"),
            original_language=tmdb_data.get("original_language"),
            poster_path=tmdb_data.get("poster_path"),
            backdrop_path=tmdb_data.get("backdrop_path"),
            vote_average=tmdb_data.get("vote_average"),
            vote_count=tmdb_data.get("vote_count"),
            popularity=tmdb_data.get("popularity"),
            created_at=datetime.utcnow(),
            updated_at=datetime.utcnow()
        )
        
        db.add(db_movie)
        db.flush()
        
        # Handle genres
        for genre_data in tmdb_data.get("genres", []):
            # Check if genre exists
            genre = db.query(Genre).filter(Genre.id == genre_data["id"]).first()
            if not genre:
                genre = Genre(
                    id=genre_data["id"],
                    name=genre_data["name"]
                )
                db.add(genre)
                db.flush()
            
            # Link movie to genre
            movie_genre = MovieGenre(movie_id=db_movie.id, genre_id=genre.id)
            db.add(movie_genre)
        
        db.commit()
        db.refresh(db_movie)
        
        return MovieResponse.from_orm(db_movie)
        
    except Exception as e:
        db.rollback()
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))

@router.get("/movies", response_model=Dict[str, Any])
async def list_movies(
    skip: int = Query(0, ge=0),
    limit: int = Query(20, ge=1, le=100),
    search: Optional[str] = None,
    genre: Optional[int] = None,
    year_from: Optional[int] = None,
    year_to: Optional[int] = None,
    sort_by: Optional[str] = Query("popularity", regex="^(popularity|release_date|title|vote_average)$"),
    sort_order: Optional[str] = Query("desc", regex="^(asc|desc)$"),
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """List movies with filtering and pagination."""
    query = db.query(Movie)
    
    # Apply filters
    if search:
        query = query.filter(Movie.title.contains(search))
    
    if genre:
        query = query.join(Movie.genres).filter(Genre.id == genre)
    
    if year_from:
        query = query.filter(Movie.release_date >= f"{year_from}-01-01")
    
    if year_to:
        query = query.filter(Movie.release_date <= f"{year_to}-12-31")
    
    # Apply sorting
    sort_column = getattr(Movie, sort_by, Movie.popularity)
    if sort_order == "desc":
        query = query.order_by(sort_column.desc())
    else:
        query = query.order_by(sort_column.asc())
    
    # Get total count
    total = query.count()
    
    # Apply pagination
    movies = query.offset(skip).limit(limit).all()
    
    return {
        "movies": [MovieResponse.from_orm(movie) for movie in movies],
        "total": total,
        "page": skip // limit + 1,
        "total_pages": (total + limit - 1) // limit
    }

@router.get("/movies/search", response_model=Dict[str, Any])
async def search_movies(
    q: str = Query(..., min_length=1),
    page: int = Query(1, ge=1),
    year: Optional[int] = None,
    include_adult: bool = Query(False),
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Search movies using TMDB API."""
    try:
        results = await tmdb_service.search_movies(q, page, year, include_adult)
        
        # Check if movies exist in our database
        enriched_results = []
        for movie_data in results["results"]:
            db_movie = db.query(Movie).filter(
                Movie.tmdb_id == movie_data["tmdb_id"]
            ).first()
            
            if db_movie:
                enriched_results.append(MovieResponse.from_orm(db_movie))
            else:
                enriched_results.append(MovieSearchResult(**movie_data))
        
        return {
            "results": enriched_results,
            "page": results["page"],
            "total_pages": results["total_pages"],
            "total_results": results["total_results"]
        }
        
    except Exception as e:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))

@router.get("/movies/trending", response_model=List[MovieSearchResult])
async def get_trending_movies(
    time_window: str = Query("week", regex="^(day|week)$"),
    limit: int = Query(20, ge=1, le=50)
):
    """Get trending movies from TMDB."""
    try:
        results = await tmdb_service.get_trending_movies(time_window)
        return [MovieSearchResult(**movie) for movie in results[:limit]]
    except Exception as e:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))

@router.get("/movies/popular", response_model=Dict[str, Any])
async def get_popular_movies(
    page: int = Query(1, ge=1),
    limit: int = Query(20, ge=1, le=100),
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Get popular movies from TMDB."""
    try:
        results = await tmdb_service.get_popular_movies(page)
        
        # Check if movies exist in our database
        enriched_results = []
        for movie_data in results["results"]:
            db_movie = db.query(Movie).filter(
                Movie.tmdb_id == movie_data["tmdb_id"]
            ).first()
            
            if db_movie:
                enriched_results.append(MovieResponse.from_orm(db_movie))
            else:
                enriched_results.append(MovieSearchResult(**movie_data))
        
        return {
            "movies": enriched_results,
            "page": results["page"],
            "total_pages": results["total_pages"],
            "total_results": results["total_results"]
        }
        
    except Exception as e:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))

@router.get("/movies/{movie_id}", response_model=MovieResponse)
async def get_movie(
    movie_id: str,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Get a specific movie by ID."""
    movie = db.query(Movie).filter(Movie.id == movie_id).first()
    if not movie:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Movie not found")
    
    return MovieResponse.from_orm(movie)

@router.put("/movies/{movie_id}", response_model=MovieResponse)
async def update_movie(
    movie_id: str,
    movie_update: MovieUpdate,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Update a movie's information."""
    movie = db.query(Movie).filter(Movie.id == movie_id).first()
    if not movie:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Movie not found")
    
    # Update fields
    update_data = movie_update.dict(exclude_unset=True)
    for field, value in update_data.items():
        setattr(movie, field, value)
    
    movie.updated_at = datetime.utcnow()
    
    try:
        db.commit()
        db.refresh(movie)
        return MovieResponse.from_orm(movie)
    except IntegrityError:
        db.rollback()
        raise HTTPException(status_code=409, detail="Update failed")

@router.delete("/movies/{movie_id}")
async def delete_movie(
    movie_id: str,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Delete a movie."""
    movie = db.query(Movie).filter(Movie.id == movie_id).first()
    if not movie:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Movie not found")
    
    try:
        db.delete(movie)
        db.commit()
        return {"message": "Movie deleted successfully"}
    except Exception as e:
        db.rollback()
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))

@router.get("/movies/{movie_id}/similar", response_model=List[MovieResponse])
async def get_similar_movies(
    movie_id: str,
    limit: int = Query(10, ge=1, le=20),
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Get similar movies based on genres."""

from fastapi import APIRouter, HTTPException, Depends, Query
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from sqlalchemy.exc import IntegrityError
from sqlalchemy import and_, desc, func
from typing import List, Optional
from uuid import uuid4
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

from models.tracking_models import (
    WatchHistoryCreate, 
    WatchHistoryUpdate, 
    WatchHistoryResponse,
    WatchStatus
)
from models.sql_models import WatchHistory, Movie, User
from services.database import get_db

router = APIRouter()

@router.post("/watch-history", response_model=WatchHistoryResponse)
async def create_watch_history(
    history: WatchHistoryCreate,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Create a new watch history entry."""
    # Check if movie exists
    movie = db.query(Movie).filter(Movie.id == history.movie_id).first()
    if not movie:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Movie not found")
    
    # Check if user exists
    user = db.query(User).filter(User.id == history.user_id).first()
    if not user:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="User not found")
    
    # Check for existing entry
    existing = db.query(WatchHistory).filter(
        and_(
            WatchHistory.movie_id == history.movie_id,
            WatchHistory.user_id == history.user_id
        )
    ).first()
    
    if existing:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=409, detail="Watch history entry already exists")
    
    # Create new entry
    db_history = WatchHistory(
        id=str(uuid4()),
        movie_id=history.movie_id,
        user_id=history.user_id,
        status=history.status,
        progress=history.progress,
        started_at=history.started_at or datetime.utcnow(),
        completed_at=history.completed_at,
        rewatch_count=history.rewatch_count,
        notes=history.notes,
        tags=",".join(history.tags) if history.tags else None,
        created_at=datetime.utcnow(),
        updated_at=datetime.utcnow()
    )
    
    try:
        db.add(db_history)
        db.commit()
        db.refresh(db_history)
        
        # Load related data
        response = WatchHistoryResponse.from_orm(db_history)
        response.movie = {
            "id": movie.id,
            "title": movie.title,
            "poster_path": movie.poster_path,
            "runtime": movie.runtime
        }
        response.total_watch_time = movie.runtime
        
        return response
        
    except IntegrityError:
        db.rollback()
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail="Failed to create watch history")

@router.get("/watch-history", response_model=List[WatchHistoryResponse])
async def get_watch_history(
    user_id: str,

):

    query = db.query(WatchHistory).join(Movie).filter(

    results = []
    for entry in history:

@router.put("/watch-history/{history_id}", response_model=WatchHistoryResponse)
async def update_watch_history(
    history_id: str,
    history_update: WatchHistoryUpdate,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Update a watch history entry."""
    entry = db.query(WatchHistory).filter(
        WatchHistory.id == history_id
    ).first()
    
    if not entry:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Watch history entry not found")
    
    # Update fields
    update_data = history_update.dict(exclude_unset=True)
    
    # Handle tags separately
    if "tags" in update_data:
        tags = update_data.pop("tags")
        update_data["tags"] = ",".join(tags) if tags else None
    
    for field, value in update_data.items():
        setattr(entry, field, value)
    
    entry.updated_at = datetime.utcnow()
    
    # Handle completion
    if history_update.status == "completed" and not entry.completed_at:
        entry.completed_at = datetime.utcnow()
        entry.progress = 100
    
    try:
        db.commit()
        db.refresh(entry)
        
        response = WatchHistoryResponse.from_orm(entry)
        response.movie = {
            "id": entry.movie.id,
            "title": entry.movie.title,
            "poster_path": entry.movie.poster_path,
            "runtime": entry.movie.runtime
        }
        response.total_watch_time = entry.movie.runtime
        
        return response
        
    except IntegrityError:
        db.rollback()
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail="Failed to update watch history")

@router.get("/watch-history/stats/{user_id}")
async def get_watch_stats(
    user_id: str,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Get user's watch statistics."""
    # Basic stats
    total_movies = db.query(WatchHistory).filter(
        WatchHistory.user_id == user_id
    ).count()
    
    completed_movies = db.query(WatchHistory).filter(
        and_(
            WatchHistory.user_id == user_id,
            WatchHistory.status == "completed"
        )
    ).count()
    
    total_watch_time = db.query(func.sum(Movie.runtime)).join(
        WatchHistory
    ).filter(
        WatchHistory.user_id == user_id
    ).scalar() or 0
    
    # Recent activity
    recent_activity = db.query(WatchHistory).join(Movie).filter(
        WatchHistory.user_id == user_id
    ).order_by(
        desc(WatchHistory.updated_at)
    ).limit(5).all()
    
    recent_items = []
    for entry in recent_activity:
        recent_items.append({
            "id": entry.id,
            "movie": {
                "id": entry.movie.id,
                "title": entry.movie.title,
                "poster_path": entry.movie.poster_path
            },
            "status": entry.status,
            "progress": entry.progress,
            "updated_at": entry.updated_at
        })
    
    # Monthly stats for the last 12 months
    monthly_stats = []
    for i in range(12):
        month_start = datetime.utcnow().replace(day=1) - timedelta(days=i*30)
        month_end = month_start + timedelta(days=30)
        
        count = db.query(WatchHistory).filter(
            and_(
                WatchHistory.user_id == user_id,
                WatchHistory.created_at >= month_start,
                WatchHistory.created_at < month_end
            )
        ).count()
        
        monthly_stats.append({
            "month": month_start.strftime("%Y-%m"),
            "count": count
        })
    
    return {
        "total_movies": total_movies,
        "completed_movies": completed_movies,
        "total_watch_time": total_watch_time,
        "recent_activity": recent_items,
        "monthly_stats": list(reversed(monthly_stats))
    }

@router.get("/watch-history/currently-watching/{user_id}")
async def get_currently_watching(
    user_id: str,
    limit: int = Query(10, ge=1, le=50),

    watching = db.query(WatchHistory).join(Movie).filter(

        desc(WatchHistory.updated_at)
    ).limit(limit).all()
    
    results = []
    for entry in watching:
        response = WatchHistoryResponse.from_orm(entry)
        response.movie = {
            "id": entry.movie.id,
            "title": entry.movie.title,
            "poster_path": entry.movie.poster_path,
            "runtime": entry.movie.runtime
        }
        response.total_watch_time = entry.movie.runtime
        results.append(response)
    
    return results

router = APIRouter()

@router.post("/ratings", response_model=Dict[str, Any])
async def create_rating(
    rating: RatingCreate,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Create or update a movie rating."""
    # Check if movie exists
    movie = db.query(Movie).filter(Movie.id == rating.movie_id).first()
    if not movie:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Movie not found")
    
    # Check if user exists
    user = db.query(User).filter(User.id == rating.user_id).first()
    if not user:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="User not found")
    
    # Check for existing rating
    existing = db.query(Rating).filter(
        and_(
            Rating.movie_id == rating.movie_id,
            Rating.user_id == rating.user_id
        )
    ).first()
    
    if existing:
        # Update existing rating
        existing.rating = rating.rating
        existing.rated_at = datetime.utcnow()
        db.commit()
        db.refresh(existing)
        
        return {
            "id": existing.id,
            "movie_id": existing.movie_id,
            "user_id": existing.user_id,
            "rating": existing.rating,
            "rated_at": existing.rated_at,
            "message": "Rating updated successfully"
        }
    
    # Create new rating
    db_rating = Rating(
        id=str(uuid4()),
        movie_id=rating.movie_id,
        user_id=rating.user_id,
        rating=rating.rating,
        rated_at=rating.rated_at
    )
    
    try:
        db.add(db_rating)
        db.commit()
        db.refresh(db_rating)
        
        return {
            "id": db_rating.id,
            "movie_id": db_rating.movie_id,
            "user_id": db_rating.user_id,
            "rating": db_rating.rating,
            "rated_at": db_rating.rated_at,
            "message": "Rating created successfully"
        }
        
    except IntegrityError:
        db.rollback()
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail="Failed to create rating")

            "title": review.movie.title,
            "poster_path": review.movie.poster_path
        }
        top_reviews_data.append(review_data)
    
    return {
        "total_reviews": total_reviews,
        "average_rating": round(average_rating, 2),
        "rating_distribution": distribution,
        "top_reviews": top_reviews_data

from fastapi import APIRouter, HTTPException, Depends, Query
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from sqlalchemy.exc import IntegrityError
from sqlalchemy import and_, desc
from typing import List, Optional
from uuid import uuid4
from datetime import datetime

from models.tracking_models import (
    WishlistCreate,
    WishlistUpdate,
    WishlistResponse
)
from models.sql_models import Wishlist, Movie, User
from services.database import get_db

router = APIRouter()

@router.post("/wishlist", response_model=WishlistResponse)
async def add_to_wishlist(
    wishlist: WishlistCreate,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Add a movie to user's wishlist."""
    # Check if movie exists
    movie = db.query(Movie).filter(Movie.id == wishlist.movie_id).first()
    if not movie:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Movie not found")
    
    # Check if user exists
    user = db.query(User).filter(User.id == wishlist.user_id).first()
    if not user:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="User not found")
    
    # Check if already in wishlist
    existing = db.query(Wishlist).filter(
        and_(
            Wishlist.movie_id == wishlist.movie_id,
            Wishlist.user_id == wishlist.user_id
        )
    ).first()
    
    if existing:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=409, detail="Movie already in wishlist")
    
    # Create new wishlist entry
    db_wishlist = Wishlist(
        id=str(uuid4()),
        movie_id=wishlist.movie_id,
        user_id=wishlist.user_id,
        priority=wishlist.priority,
        notes=wishlist.notes,
        added_at=wishlist.added_at,
        reminder_date=wishlist.reminder_date,
        created_at=datetime.utcnow(),
        updated_at=datetime.utcnow()
    )
    
    try:
        db.add(db_wishlist)
        db.commit()
        db.refresh(db_wishlist)
        
        response = WishlistResponse.from_orm(db_wishlist)
        response.movie = {
            "id": movie.id,
            "title": movie.title,
            "poster_path": movie.poster_path,
            "release_date": movie.release_date
        }
        response.estimated_release_date = movie.release_date
        
        return response
        
    except IntegrityError:
        db.rollback()
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail="Failed to add to wishlist")

@router.get("/wishlist", response_model=List[WishlistResponse])
async def get_wishlist(
    user_id: str,
    priority: Optional[int] = None,
    limit: int = Query(50, ge=1, le=100),
    offset: int = Query(0, ge=0),
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Get user's wishlist with optional priority filtering."""
    query = db.query(Wishlist).join(Movie).filter(
        Wishlist.user_id == user_id
    )
    
    if priority:
        query = query.filter(Wishlist.priority == priority)
    
    wishlist = query.order_by(
        Wishlist.priority.desc(),
        desc(Wishlist.created_at)
    ).offset(offset).limit(limit).all()
    
    results = []
    for item in wishlist:
        response = WishlistResponse.from_orm(item)
        response.movie = {
            "id": item.movie.id,
            "title": item.movie.title,
            "poster_path": item.movie.poster_path,
            "release_date": item.movie.release_date
        }
        response.estimated_release_date = item.movie.release_date
        results.append(response)
    
    return results

@router.get("/wishlist/{wishlist_id}", response_model=WishlistResponse)
async def get_wishlist_item(
    wishlist_id: str,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Get a specific wishlist item."""
    item = db.query(Wishlist).filter(
        Wishlist.id == wishlist_id
    ).first()
    
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Wishlist item not found")
    
    response = WishlistResponse.from_orm(item)
    response.movie = {
        "id": item.movie.id,
        "title": item.movie.title,
        "poster_path": item.movie.poster_path,
        "release_date": item.movie.release_date
    }
    response.estimated_release_date = item.movie.release_date
    
    return response

@router.put("/wishlist/{wishlist_id}", response_model=WishlistResponse)
async def update_wishlist_item(
    wishlist_id: str,
    wishlist_update: WishlistUpdate,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Update a wishlist item."""
    item = db.query(Wishlist).filter(
        Wishlist.id == wishlist_id
    ).first()
    
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Wishlist item not found")
    
    # Update fields
    update_data = wishlist_update.dict(exclude_unset=True)
    for field, value in update_data.items():
        setattr(item, field, value)
    
    item.updated_at = datetime.utcnow()
    
    try:
        db.commit()
        db.refresh(item)
        
        response = WishlistResponse.from_orm(item)
        response.movie = {
            "id": item.movie.id,
            "title": item.movie.title,
            "poster_path": item.movie.poster_path,
            "release_date": item.movie.release_date
        }
        response.estimated_release_date = item.movie.release_date
        
        return response
        
    except IntegrityError:
        db.rollback()
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail="Failed to update wishlist item")

@router.delete("/wishlist/{wishlist_id}")
async def remove_from_wishlist(
    wishlist_id: str,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Remove a movie from wishlist."""
    item = db.query(Wishlist).filter(
        Wishlist.id == wishlist_id
    ).first()
    
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Wishlist item not found")
    
    try:
        db.delete(item)
        db.commit()
        return {"message": "Movie removed from wishlist successfully"}
    except Exception as e:
        db.rollback()
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))

@router.get("/wishlist/check/{user_id}/{movie_id}")
async def check_wishlist_status(
    user_id: str,
    movie_id: str,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Check if a movie is in user's wishlist."""
    item = db.query(Wishlist).filter(
        and_(
            Wishlist.user_id == user_id,
            Wishlist.movie_id == movie_id
        )
    ).first()
    
    if item:
        return {
            "in_wishlist": True,
            "priority": item.priority,
            "notes": item.notes,
            "added_at": item.added_at
        }
    
    return {"in_wishlist": False}

@router.get("/wishlist/stats/{user_id}")
async def get_wishlist_stats(
    user_id: str,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Get user's wishlist statistics."""
    total_items = db.query(Wishlist).filter(
        Wishlist.user_id == user_id
    ).count()
    
    priority_stats = db.query(
        Wishlist.priority,
        func.count(Wishlist.id).label('count')
    ).filter(
        Wishlist.user_id == user_id
    ).group_by(
        Wishlist.priority
    ).order_by(
        Wishlist.priority.desc()
    ).all()
    
    upcoming_releases = db.query(Wishlist).join(Movie).filter(
        and_(
            Wishlist.user_id == user_id,
            Movie.release_date >= datetime.utcnow().date()
        )
    ).order_by(
        Movie.release_date
    ).limit(5).all()
    
    upcoming = []
    for item in upcoming_releases:
        upcoming.append({
            "id": item.id,
            "movie": {
                "id": item.movie.id,
                "title": item.movie.title,
                "poster_path": item.movie.poster_path,
                "release_date": item.movie.release_date
            },
            "priority": item.priority,
            "notes": item.notes
        })
    
    return {
        "total_items": total_items,
        "priority_distribution": [
            {"priority": p, "count": c} for p, c in priority_stats
        ],
        "upcoming_releases": upcoming
    }

@router.post("/wishlist/{wishlist_id}/move-up")
async def move_wishlist_priority_up(
    wishlist_id: str,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Increase priority of a wishlist item."""
    item = db.query(Wishlist).filter(
        Wishlist.id == wishlist_id
    ).first()
    
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Wishlist item not found")
    
    if item.priority < 5:
        item.priority += 1
        item.updated_at = datetime.utcnow()
        
        try:
            db.commit()
            db.refresh(item)
            
            response = WishlistResponse.from_orm(item)
            response.movie = {
                "id": item.movie.id,
                "title": item.movie.title,
                "poster_path": item.movie.poster_path,
                "release_date": item.movie.release_date
            }
            response.estimated_release_date = item.movie.release_date
            
            return response
            
        except Exception as e:
            db.rollback()
            raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))
    
    return {"message": "Already at maximum priority"}

@router.post("/wishlist/{wishlist_id}/move-down")
async def move_wishlist_priority_down(
    wishlist_id: str,
    db: Session = Depends(get_db)
):
    """Decrease priority of a wishlist item."""
    item = db.query(Wishlist).filter(
        Wishlist.id == wishlist_id
    ).first()
    
    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Wishlist item not found")
    
    if item.priority > 1:
        item.priority -= 1
        item.updated_at = datetime.utcnow()
        
        try:
            db.commit()
            db.refresh(item)
            
            response = WishlistResponse.from_orm(item)
            response.movie = {
                "id": item.movie.id,
                "title": item.movie.title,
                "poster_path": item.movie.poster_path,
                "release_date": item.movie.release_date
            }
            response.estimated_release_date = item.movie.release_date
            
            return response
            
        except Exception as e:
            db.rollback()
            raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))
    
    return {"message": "Already at minimum priority"}

from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
from services import api_router

app = FastAPI(title="Project Backend API", version="1.0.0")

# CORS configuration for frontend
app.add_middleware(
    CORSMiddleware,
    allow_origins=["*"],
    allow_credentials=True,
    allow_methods=["*"],
    allow_headers=["*"],
)

# Include the main API router
app.include_router(api_router, prefix="/api")

@app.get("/")
def read_root():
    return {"status": "Backend API running"}

@app.get("/health")
def health_check():
    return {"status": "healthy"}

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=8000)
```

from fastapi import APIRouter
from pydantic import BaseModel
from datetime import datetime

router = APIRouter()

class HealthResponse(BaseModel):
    status: str
    timestamp: str
    service: str

@router.get("/health", response_model=HealthResponse)
async def health_check():
    return HealthResponse(
        status="healthy",
        timestamp=datetime.now().isoformat(),
        service="backend-api"
    )
```

import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import { Review, ReviewFormData } from '@/types/review';

export const useReviews = (movieId?: string) => {
  const [reviews, setReviews] = useState<Review[]>([]);
  const [isLoading, setIsLoading] = useState(false);

  const fetchReviews = async () => {
    setIsLoading(true);
    try {
      // Mock data
      const mockReviews: Review[] = [
        {
          id: '1',
          movie_id: movieId || '1',
          user_id: '1',
          title: 'Amazing movie!',
          content: 'This was an incredible film with outstanding performances.',
          rating: 5,
          contains_spoilers: false,
          tags: ['action', 'thriller'],
          created_at: new Date().toISOString(),
          updated_at: new Date().toISOString(),
          user: {
            id: '1',
            username: 'demo_user',
            avatar_url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1535713875002-d1d0cf377fde?w=50&h=50&fit=crop&crop=face'
          },
          likes_count: 15,
          comments_count: 3,
          is_liked: false
        }
      ];
      setReviews(mockReviews);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching reviews:', error);
    } finally {
      setIsLoading(false);
    }
  };

  const createReview = async (data: ReviewFormData) => {
    const newReview: Review = {
      id: Date.now().toString(),
      movie_id: movieId || '1',
      user_id: '1',
      ...data,
      created_at: new Date().toISOString(),
      updated_at: new Date().toISOString(),
      user: {
        id: '1',
        username: 'demo_user',
        avatar_url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1535713875002-d1d0cf377fde?w=50&h=50&fit=crop&crop=face'
      },
      likes_count: 0,
      comments_count: 0,
      is_liked: false
    };
    setReviews(prev => [newReview, ...prev]);
  };

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchReviews();
  }, [movieId]);

  return {
    reviews,
    isLoading,
    createReview,
    refetch: fetchReviews
  };
};
